reviewText: If you ever watched FitTv then you will know this workout.  It is exactly the workout I missed when FitTv was rudely changed to Discovery Fit & Health.

reviewText: It's a decent tape. You are able to pick the track you would like to view. The muscle groups are broken down. It's the typical fitness instructor tape; slow pace, light music, talking from the instuctor. Good workout. It is all weights and some resistance. I would recommend.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a super cool workout, but I'm not on that level yet.Working my way to it.I'm on Cathe's beginner series, and I can tell you that even her beginner stuff is smoking and gets you results. It makes you stronger and able to do more.But I really dig Muscle Max. It blows my mind to just watch. And I can't wait until I've hit that level. I suspect that I'll be ready in a few months.But this isn't a workout I can see any possibility of outgrowing.No matter how advanced you are, Muscle Max will Max you out.But you need some equipment to do it. A barbell, dumbbells, a step board, stretch bands, a stability ball.I tried the Fire Walk part of it though. Whoo! Boy, do I feel it big time in my hips and buns. Big time! That Fire Walk is something else!I'm building up my Cathe collection. I have six of her DVD's so far. And I'll be getting like 6 more at leaet. I decided to stick with Cathe for life. Word!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I surprised myself at how much I enjoy this workout.  I normally prefer to do heavy weight work with splits, e.g. working only one or two body parts per day.  This workout is good for working your body differently.I would consider this to be more of an endurance workout than a strength building one since you're not lifting that heavy and not doing that many exercises for each body part.What I loved about this workout:**It's tough!  I had to use lower weights than Cathe was using. I was happy about this since matching Cathe's weights is something I'll work towards.**All body parts are thoroughly worked, including core.**The time flew by.  While there are just so many ways you can work, Cathe makes it interesting by doing slow reps and by using different equipment.  I liked using the barbell, dumbbells and band since they all work muscles differently.**Cathe told you what weights she was using; this is a helpful guide.**Cathe and crew make equipment changes on screen so you're not scrambling to do so before the next exercise starts.**The 3 premixes:  upper body, lower body and timesaver.  These are good for when you're short on time.**The music was upbeat and fit the workout; the tunes were also recognizable.  (I mention this because I felt the music in Cathe's later workouts is not so good.)Cathe does use a lot of equipment in this workout, which may be a problem for some.  You can always just continue to use a barbell or dumbbells or just a band if that's all you have, you'll still get a good workout.I highly recommend this workout for those wanting a tough total body workout.
summary: A good, solid total body weight workout
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a solid weights workout in the style of gym group fitness workouts like body pump etc.It covers all areas of the body in the total 68 minute workout or can be broken down into upper body, lower body and time saver workouts.I will say that if the amount of equipment required (barbell,dumbbells,resistance band,step) seems daunting, it's not necessary. I've been doing the workout with just a set of adjustable dumbbells and it's fine. As my abilities progress I will probably need a barbell to do heavier weight, but for now a pair of  5-15lb dumbbells gets me through the heavier parts fine and I can feel it the next day. So if you're beginner to intermediate you could put the other equipment on hold for a while and still get a good workout and add things as time and budget allows.This workout is good for all levels in my opinion.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Cathe delivers again! This is an awesome total body workout. It's a weight based circuit workout that cycles through all the major muscle groups - legs (twice), chest, back, shoulders, biceps, triceps, and core work. This workout doesn't miss anything. I felt each muscle group was completely fatigued by the end, and I was very skeptical about the lower body portions. I kept thinking, "how am I going to fatigue my lower body with only four exercises?" But, why oh why do I doubt Cathe? The plie squats brought me to TOTAL fatigue, and only one other workout (Cathe's Gym Style Legs - the overall thigh burner) has ever done that for me. And, she managed to do it with only one 15 pound weight! When it was over my legs were shaking so bad I couldn't even walk to put my weight down. Definitely get this workout! If you put in the time and lift heavy - you will get results.
Title: N/A
